SQL_LINKED_SERVICE = "AzureSqlDatabase1"

# Set the linked service name for SQL authentication
spark.conf.set("spark.synapse.linkedServiceName", SQL_LINKED_SERVICE)

# JDBC URL format (no credentials needed if using a linked service)
jdbc_url = f"jdbc:sqlserver://iristestsql.database.windows.net:1433;database=iris-test"


# Read data using the linked service
df = spark.read \
    .format("jdbc") \
    .option("url", jdbc_url) \
    .option("dbtable", "Customers") \
    .option("driver", "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver") \
    .option("authentication", "ActiveDirectoryMSI") \
    .load()

df.show()
